intro: Hyalosperma simplex, commonly known as the slender glasswort, is a species of flowering plant in the family Amaranthaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, glassy appearance, with leaves that are often translucent or semi-translucent. This plant typically grows in coastal areas, where it thrives in salty, well-drained soils. Hyalosperma simplex is often found in sandy or muddy habitats, and it plays a role in stabilizing coastal dunes. Its unique morphology makes it an interesting subject for botanical study and ecological research.
